poem:
### Crustacean Discovery

In a sack of prawns,  
a singular tale—  
a shell, armoured  
like dreams without claws.  
The boy, eyes wide,  
captures the sea's secrets,  
a scientist born  
from ordinary wonder,  
where the world shifts  
on delicate tails  
and hunger  
tastes of salt and mystery.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How a Sydney scientist became enamoured with the ‘Ferraris of the crustacean world’ – and discovered a new shrimp species When Prof Shane Ahyong was seven, his mum came home with a bag of prawns from the fish shop – but one of those things was not like the others. “It just looked different,” said Ahyong. “It looked a bit like an armoured lobster just without the big claws. I was amazed.” What had caught". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
